title: Setts calling card is unfair for supports
body: In the recent dev update they said that setts calling card was given to those who consistently got first blood... But that's kinda unfair to supports who aren't meant to take kills...

replies.body:
It's more thematic than anything else. If you're a backline healer who isn't aggressive, you're not gonna get an invite to play with the boss man himself. Thems the works. 

More importantly, this _Setts_ the precedent of Riot doing new champion promotions like this in the future, giving out the champion for free to players who do things that cater to the new champion's playstyle. Sett is all about aggression and getting in people's faces, so he's given out to players who get first blood a lot. A future champion might reward you for never dying during a match or setting up a ton of assists with stuns or other things that might appeal to a support player, and that's when you'd get your free champ.

Yeah, but literally every single role, regardless of what champion type you are, is encouraged to get first blood EXCEPT for supports. You could be Heimerdinger or a Xerath, who are not brawlers that Sett would even entertain fighting in his arena, and yet they would be encouraged to get first blood.

In fairness though, if you're that die-hard a support main to only play Support, are you realllllyyy going to be picking up Sett? Yes, people like free stuff and free champs, however, by making a mission that rewards people for aggression with a free aggressive champ, you're giving the champion to the people *Most* likely to enjoy him and play him, as opposed to a support main who at most might play him sometimes, or trade in champion select.

> [{quoted}](name=Academy Kayn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NaQ6qMXp,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2020-01-14T23:22:23.685+0000)
>
> In fairness though, if you're that die-hard a support main to only play Support, are you realllllyyy going to be picking up Sett? Yes, people like free stuff and free champs, however, by making a mission that rewards people for aggression with a free aggressive champ, you're giving the champion to the people *Most* likely to enjoy him and play him, as opposed to a support main who at most might play him sometimes, or trade in champion select.

In an MMO this would make quite a bit of sense, but league of legends is not an MMO and the requirements of the mission mean that people will inevitably be excluded from a free _975RP_. 
Anyone would be mad if they lost out on a free ten bucks simply because of their preferences.  

The mission should have included assists on first blood, for the sake of fairness to all because at that point _everyone_ has an equal opportunity. 
That being said, the mission itself should be hidden _entirely_ with a hint on the reward, so the information doesnt spread like wildfire.

Why does it matter if *some* people lose out on a free champ? Just because something is free does not mean everyone deserves to be able to get it. If people found out about the achievement, support players could've cheesed their way to obtaining it by going into Bot games, just like how I got a majority of my first bloods. 

But by nature, the people who are going to discover this mission by accident when they unlock it, are going to be the aggressive players getting first blood. Those who are most likely going to enjoy the champion are the ones most likely to unlock it. If some people don't, oh well, sucks, not everyone needs to have free stuff. Support mains are by far the least likely to enjoy this champion, so why does it matter if they lose out on a champion they're not going to play?

It's not about everyone getting the free stuff. It's about a challenge that was laid out. If you really wanted Sett's calling card when you found out about it as a Support player, it's all fair that you could try to go after first bloods yourself, even switching a role. There's nothing like an MMO where you're stuck playing a Support character, anyone can play aggressive champions. But the ones who are most going to appreciate this, are the aggressive players, not supports, which is why it was geared for them to unlock the easiest.

And who are you to say that people wouldnt like something based entirely on their preferences? Im a Yuumi main - but i enjoyed Sett greatly on PBE and would have loved the opportunity to get him for free. 
This is like if your local grocer had... lets say a car event where you got a free ten dollar gift card if you showed your ten favorite cars, but only told regulars who they already knew liked cars about it.  

As for cheesing it, thats a fault on riot _and i already gave an exclusivity thing in my post_. 

> But by nature, the people who are going to discover this mission by accident when they unlock it, are going to be the aggressive players getting first blood. Those who are most likely going to enjoy the champion are the ones most likely to unlock it. If some people don't, oh well, sucks, not everyone needs to have free stuff. Support mains are by far the least likely to enjoy this champion, so why does it matter if they lose out on a champion they're not going to play?

Not everyone needs free stuff, but every player deserves the _opportunity in the first place_. Saying "x player" doesnt deserve it because of their preferences is... Almost bigoted, and certainly discriminatory. 
While you can cleanly argue that it was "available" to everyone with a signifigant bias, its still a fact that supports are generally the class with the least amount of first bloods. Intrinsically even. 
  
> It's not about everyone getting the free stuff. It's about a challenge that was laid out. If you really wanted Sett's calling card when you found out about it as a Support player, it's all fair that you could try to go after first bloods yourself, even switching a role. There's nothing like an MMO where you're stuck playing a Support character, anyone can play aggressive champions. But the ones who are most going to appreciate this, are the aggressive players, not supports, which is why it was geared for them to unlock the easiest.

If you want to say its about a challenge that was laid out then it should have _not been secret_ and should have been accompanied by a pre-release event with say five quests that end in an invitation to setts fight pits.  
Also youve been repeating what amounts to "supports just wont like sett" as if its an absolute and people cant enjoy more than one type of champion. Who are you trying to convince here, me or yourself?

I mean, it's no different than a mission that says:

"Play 10 games where you bought a support item to unlock the new champ for free"

I don't think every other role would be upset that they can't complete the mission on their role.
